1.text: The word of the LORD that came to Joel the son of Pethuel.

2.text: Hear this, you old men, and give ear, all you inhabitants of the land. Has this been in your days, or even in the days of your fathers?

3.text: Tell you your children of it, and let your children tell their children, and their children another generation.

4.text: That which the palmerworm has left has the locust eaten; and that which the locust has left has the cankerworm eaten; and that which the cankerworm has left has the caterpillar eaten.

5.text: Awake, you drunkards, and weep; and howl, all you drinkers of wine, because of the new wine; for it is cut off from your mouth.

6.text: For a nation is come up on my land, strong, and without number, whose teeth are the teeth of a lion, and he has the cheek teeth of a great lion.

7.text: He has laid my vine waste, and barked my fig tree: he has made it clean bore, and cast it away; the branches thereof are made white.

8.text: Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth for the husband of her youth.

9.text: The meat offering and the drink offering is cut off from the house of the LORD; the priests, the LORDâ€™s ministers, mourn.

10.text: The field is wasted, the land mourns; for the corn is wasted: the new wine is dried up, the oil languishes.

11.text: Be you ashamed, O you farmers; howl, O you vinedressers, for the wheat and for the barley; because the harvest of the field is perished.

12.text: The vine is dried up, and the fig tree languishes; the pomegranate tree, the palm tree also, and the apple tree, even all the trees of the field, are withered: because joy is withered away from the sons of men.

13.text: Gird yourselves, and lament, you priests: howl, you ministers of the altar: come, lie all night in sackcloth, you ministers of my God: for the meat offering and the drink offering is withheld from the house of your God.

14.text: Sanctify you a fast, call a solemn assembly, gather the elders and all the inhabitants of the land into the house of the LORD your God, and cry to the LORD,

15.text: Alas for the day! for the day of the LORD is at hand, and as a destruction from the Almighty shall it come.

16.text: Is not the meat cut off before our eyes, yes, joy and gladness from the house of our God?

17.text: The seed is rotten under their clods, the garners are laid desolate, the barns are broken down; for the corn is withered.

18.text: How do the beasts groan! the herds of cattle are perplexed, because they have no pasture; yes, the flocks of sheep are made desolate.

19.text: O LORD, to you will I cry: for the fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness, and the flame has burned all the trees of the field.

20.text: The beasts of the field cry also to you: for the rivers of waters are dried up, and the fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness.
